ygData.subject: Hi and welcome
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi everyone, my name is Christina, and I created EQ_rainbow.  I m happy to see that 16 people have joined us in just 24 hours.  It s hard to tell with
ygData.messageBody:
Hi everyone, my name is Christina, and I created EQ_rainbow. I'm happy to see that 16 people have joined us in just 24 hours. It's hard to tell with something like this how quickly and how many people will join. I'm going to use this message to say briefly why I created this list, and to tell you a bit about who I am.

One of the first things I noticed in Everquest was that it prohibited anti-gay guilds and harassment. At the time I just thought "cool" and brushed it off, but it kind of sunk in after a while. It made me feel comfortable as a bisexual woman, knowing that (officially at least) homophobia was prohibited.

However, in playing the game I noticed also that there was no queer visibility. I have seen a lot of heterosexual visibility, in particular I've seen a lot of het online marriages. I've thought sometimes about defining one of my characters as a lesbian, but it's seemed like a daunting task.

By forming EQ rainbow I've hoped to meet other les/bi/gay/tg everquest players, outside of the game, in a relaxed chat environment. I'm hoping this will help me realize, and all of you realize, that we are out there, playing that game, on every server!

Just to give some biographical information on myself, I'm a 26 year old bisexual woman from Toronto Canada. I work a computer programmer. I do volunteer work here in our amazing queer community, and I love it.

I hope this list will be a positive space for all lesbian/gay/bi/tg identified Everquest players. I also want this list to welcome straight-identified and queer-positive Everquest players.

*hugs*

Christina


---------------------------------------------------
